item.title: Rectangle (AABB) Collisions
item.description: Axis-aligned bounding boxes (AABBs) are very useful for doing simple collision detection and 2D physics. The basic idea is: loop through the boxes, checking for intersections with each other box. Then, you resolve these intersections by moving the boxes in the direction of the shortest intersection axis. So if the width of the intersection is smaller than its height, like it is here, then the boxes are moved on the x axis:
